meanings.definition: Practicing or advocating strict religious or moral behavior
meanings.sent1: The puritanical preacher condemned any form of entertainment in the town.
meanings.sent2: Her puritanical beliefs led her to attend church every day without fail.
meanings.sent3: The puritanical cat refused to play with any toy that wasn't made of natural materials.
meanings.sent4: His puritanical dedication to his diet made him avoid any food with even a hint of sugar.
meanings.sent5: The puritanical rules of the household forbade any form of frivolity or laughter.

meanings.definition: Characterized by strict adherence to moral principles
meanings.sent1: The puritanical community upheld their values with unwavering dedication.
meanings.sent2: His puritanical approach to honesty meant he never told a lie.
meanings.sent3: The puritanical student refused to cheat on the exam, even when tempted.
meanings.sent4: The puritanical judge's decisions were always based on his strong moral compass.
meanings.sent5: Her puritanical commitment to kindness made her a beloved figure in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: Excessively strict or severe in behavior or attitudes
meanings.sent1: The puritanical teacher gave detention for the smallest infractions.
meanings.sent2: His puritanical views on discipline made him unpopular among his peers.
meanings.sent3: The puritanical boss expected his employees to work long hours without complaint.
meanings.sent4: Her puritanical approach to cleanliness meant the house was spotless at all times.
meanings.sent5: The puritanical coach demanded absolute obedience from his players during practice.
